summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorney Bruce Barket and a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The emails discuss the status of an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt, with Barket requesting that his client, Nick Tartaglione, not be interviewed without his permission. The staff attorney confirms the investigation has concluded with no charges.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney representing Nick Tartaglione. He is corresponding with MCC staff about the investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt and requests that his client not be interviewed without his permission.

persons.name: Nick Tartaglione
persons.context: Client of attorney Bruce Barket. Barket requests that investigators not interview Tartaglione about the Epstein investigation without his permission.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation referenced in the emails, specifically regarding his suicide attempt while incarcerated at MCC New York.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the legal counsel for Nick Tartaglione, as evidenced by his request that investigators not interview Tartaglione without his permission.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt Investigation
events.description: An investigation is conducted regarding Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Investigation Conclusion Notification
events.description: A Supervisory Staff Attorney informs Bruce Barket that the investigation into Epstein's suicide attempt has concluded and no charges are being filed.

keyFacts: An investigation was conducted into Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt while he was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The investigation concluded with no charges or disciplinary actions being filed, as communicated to attorney Bruce Barket on August 10, 2019.
Attorney Bruce Barket requested that his client, inmate Nick Tartaglione, not be interviewed about the Epstein investigation without his explicit permission.
The email chain indicates the correctional facility was on lockdown on August 10, 2019, due to an incident 'all over the press,' likely referring to Epstein's death.
